content.label: This game is fun to play, and it challenges you more and more as you begin to understand it better and develop strategies. Five stars, but if I had a suggestion, I think you should have a pause/restart menu. It'd let players save their progress and would allow them to start over if they know they made a sequence of bad moves that will ultimately lead to a bad score.

This game is great. Lots of depth. But the game need leaderboards and Game Center support. I want to get some friend score wars going on. Also, is there an easier way to restart?

Great game. Minimal art and sound in the best way.

Worth 2.99. I'd pay 5 for it.
such an original game. don't think i've ever played anything like this before. simplicity at its best in terms of the game itself as well as the sleek interface design. thanks for developing !

Simogo continues to amaze- each release is so different from the other, while maintaining quality, depth, and uniqueness.  These guys are not just cranking out sequels and match three games!  

Spl-t is a wonderful, addictive puzzler built for simple touch controls.  I'm at 40k score with 300 splits and I can't stop trying to beat it.   Just one more game....

Whether it's Device 6, Year Walk, or now Spl-t, you can't go wrong with a Simogo app.

title.label: Great game! Wish I could turn off sounds!

content.label: This is a great game.  Simple design but not easy to master.  My only complaint is that you can not turn off sounds...
Not sure why some people love this game so much. It's stressful and boring.

Elegant, multilayered, sinister, and deep experience. I have been playing for weeks now and the experience and thinking that unfold in SPL-T are amongst the most satisfying and challenging of any puzzle game I've played this year. 5 stars. A possible classic. Ruining my life.

I like the fact that it's innovative and it's kind of fun to play that is why I gave it three stars. I can't possibly see how you could get really good at it and play a game for more than five minutes. Also once you started a game there's no way to quit it without getting all the possible splits.  that is mainly why It lost two stars
Buy it! And try giving it a shake during gameplay :)

When I first opened this game it was not immediately apparent how great it is. Reading the instructions is fairly necessary though you can figure out the general mechanics without doing so. 

I've been playing for a few days now and I've already changed my strategy completely several times. There is a lot of hidden depth to this game. Very fun, no time pressure at all. Doesn't look ridiculous in public. Definitely worth a buy.

Source: Brought enough apps at this point I shouldn't talk about it. I don't review but this game is 5 stars. (Also math major, maybe that's affecting my score)
I wish the game would save after more than a few minutes of being inactive.

It's not a bad game it's just I've been playing for about a day now and my highest score was when I first played and I had no idea what to do and I was randomly clicking things. I am pretty bad, but I do better randomly clicking than strategically playing. I don't think it should cost that much.
Spl-t will sit on my phone right next to Threes and Drop 7 as a perfect 5 minute game that I'll never grow tired of. What a pleasant surprise.

Why are there no reviews yet? I'm sure I'm not the first person to download this game. It took a few days to understand what was going on with the game, but now I understand & it's a cool game. I hope there are a bunch of Easter eggs to find :)
Very good.

Seems like a decent (if ugly) puzzler, but when my phone runs out of battery, it loses game state and I have to start over.  I am definitely not going to risk the time to play this until they fix that.  iPhone 6 running latest OS.
Spl-t is nothing less than a work of genius. Found it through the Wired article.

I am not a huge video game person but the simplicity and yet, inability to score well, on this one sucked me in. It took me days to get anything beyond a seemingly accidental okay score. Today I finally figured a bit of a strategy, and somehow got over 26K! Next two games, around 2K. It's really quite challenging and a temptation. Try it.
Minimalism at its best.

Imagine if Ingmar Bergman had made Threes.

Seemingly complex, it soon reveals itself to be elegant and intuitive. Terrifyingly simple, but I am still discovering new strategies after hundreds of games. Completely deterministic, yet every game is completely different. How did they do it? Utter brilliance.

Spl-t is driving me crazy. I'm normally not a huge puzzle person, but I'm dying to figure out the right algorithm for this game. I've tried so many different methods - symmetry, math, patterns - and the highest score I can manage is 13,000. An amazing game through and through.

Hard to get but I like that. People that rated 1 star probably did that because they didn't even give the game 5 minutes and couldn't solve a puzzle even if their life depended on it, a shame :/ but once you get it its more of a challenge and a puzzle iv'e ever had, now my top game on my phone, Simogo always did do a good job with they're games. Worth it
This game is addicting... I rack up some good points then suddenly I'm out! Keeps you coming back.

title.label: Good game but missing a few things

content.label:
I enjoy the simplicity in this, but it's a little open-ended for my tastes. Would like to see another game mode where there is a bit more urgency. Almost like Drop7 style.

Also, if you're having a good run, DONT CLOSE THE APP. You will lose everything you worked for. This is a big problem and hopefully will get fixed.

title.label: The more I play, the more I love it.

content.label: This game is infuriatingly simple. But it is hard to pin down a good strategy. I have been playing for 40 minutes solid. I will get a new high score and then, frustratingly, be unable to recreate anything close to that score the next game.

This is proof that ultra-minimalist design can work: take a solid gameplay premise and let it speak for itself. No shattery glass, gems, or energy meters. Just pure play. And it does work. It's just...there isn't a lot of replay to it. I don't know what it is, but it seems to get stale after a while. But I can say in response to the reviews that claim it's random -- it isn't. This takes strategy and planning. A clever puzzle that's not for everybody. Read the ? File to learn the basics. I'd give it a B+

I love the game. It’s cute and simple and terribly difficult. I really really enjoy it.

There are 2 main features that the game lacks:
1. Suspended play
2. Mute sound

I play on the subway while listening to audiobooks / podcasts. The clicks and pops of the soundtrack are nice, but tiring… and definitely hurt my ears when my other audio gain is low. Also, since I’m on the subway, occasionally I have to leave the game to walk home or go to work. I have lost a lot of great starts because of this. Both of these features are table stakes for modern iOS games. Please update.

Otherwise, great!

EXISTING PLAYERS:
Play upside down!
Did you shake the game yet?

Spl-t works has a very simple set of rules. The rules seem so absurd at first, you can't even form any strategy -- you just play. But as you play, game after game, you slowly get to understand it more. With every game, you build upon your failures.

The rules never change, and there are no new items or levels. But it gets better and better as you play. What an incredibly elegant game.

title.label: Crazy freaking hard, in all the right ways

content.label: This is a puzzle game where you last as long as you can before inevitably losing to the rising pressure, like Tetris or 2048. But this game is so unique and unlike anything else I've played. The strategies you have to form for this game are so elaborate and convoluted, changing as you progress and forcing you into corners you didn't know existed. This game is elaborate, easy to understand and hard to master. Six stars. Keep it up lads!

title.label: Deceptively simple and fun as heck!

content.label: It doesn't look like much, but once you wrap your head around how to play the game it quickly becomes a "just ONE more try" game just like Tetris or Threes! Charming in its minimalism, and just a lot of fun!
I don't often write app reviews, but the challenge of keeping this grid splittable is incredibly addicting. Worth your three bucks!

LOVE everything Simogo does. This one is minimal and shockingly narrative free but has a high learning curve & feels incredibly deep. 
I'm up to 17,000pts. 
FYI, messing with the menu uncovers color options & a hidden balance game. Could there be a hidden narrative?
Just found a secret game this game has... and the thing is the secret game is also fun. ;)
I love a good puzzler. This is not a good puzzler.  Awkward, unrewarding, mundane, annoying. Annoyed!

title.label: Yes, I get it. It's still boring.

content.label: Yes, I know how it works. Yes, I've played it (a lot longer than I should have). Yes, it's still boring.
If you don't like this game, it's probably because you don't understand it.
Dang, this game is good. Sit with it for a bit. Very deep.
Love, mom.
love this game. I really want this for my watch. it'd be perfect

I don't know ... the spacing between the 10th and 11th diagonal line in the app icon looks like it's 1 or 2 pixels wider than it should be. Same goes for the 20th and 21st line (yer it somehow seems like less of a gap): I'm sure this was a design decision to eff with our heads but I'm just sayin' "I see what you did there" - for the record - if you catch my drift... Great job for real though.

Great game. Sound effects can not be muted. 

Or. 

I can't figure out where to mute them.

Just right amount of analysis paralysis for a fun little puzzle box. 

Beware:addictive.

Don't listen to most of the people giving it one star-they didn't play long enough to figure out how it works. It's more than just splitting boxes. Overall fun game, but I'd love to see another game similar to device 6, year walk and sailors dream. It's easy to find puzzle-type games like this(although this is a bit different and worthwhile imo) but there is a lack of compelling story based games, and no one makes them like Simogo!

This game is crack. Last night I had hours disappear, splitting rectangles. It's brilliantly simple but hard to explain. You have to figure it out yourself, those bad reviews are from people too impatient to give it a chance. This is seriously my favorite puzzle game.

Ignore the 1 star reviews. It might take a second to understand the logic but it makes sense and is quite addictive. 

Wish list: 

Ability to mute sounds
Saved game progress
GameCenter integration
If you're debating, just go ahead and buy it. Because if you've played Year Walk you'll really like this game. And I'm not talking about the story, I mean the gameplay.
Dont believe the negative reviews. They don't get it.
Aside from an amazingly engrossing main game, Spl-t actually has a story to it, really enjoying unlocking all that this incredibly simple game has to offer.
As complex as you make it.

Incredibly boring game. I don't even understand what you're supposed to do besides randomly hit squares until they split up and count down. Really nothing about this game is worthwhile, I deleted it after 5 minutes. Don't waste $3 on it.
